critique: The document is an executive order focused on increasing opportunities for disadvantaged businesses in federal procurement. It emphasizes non-discrimination and affirmative action to include Small Disadvantaged Businesses (SDBs), businesses in the section 8(a) Business Development program (8(a)s), and Minority Business Enterprises (MBEs). It directs executive departments and agencies to take steps to increase contracting with these businesses, including using price evaluation preference programs, encouraging mentoring relationships, and providing training and technical assistance. The order also addresses federal advertising, information technology, General Services Administration schedules, and bundling contracts. It requests independent agencies to comply and clarifies that the order does not create any enforceable right or benefit.
